programme.desc: A look at a family-run airline in Alaska that battles the Arctic elements to transport supplies and people to some of the worlds most inaccessible areas

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Luke flies dangerous chemicals to a remote village, and when winter claims its first victim in Unalakleet, Jim makes arrangements to transport the casket

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: An injured deer is found hiding in a shed after being attacked. The game wardens pull over a suspicious vehicle and notice the driver is hiding something under his seat

programme.desc: The team heads to Romania to help with an out-of-control street dog problem. They also treat an injured European bison and try to restore a dogs hearing

programme.sub-title: The Day the Ice Road Shattered
programme.desc: The Kilchers work together to recover a stranded tractor, and Otto puts his safety on the line as he races to get the vehicle started before the ice road melts

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Four baby goats are rushed into the Houston SPCA shelter with life-threatening injuries after being attacked by stray dogs

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits Englands oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: Documentary that goes behind the scenes of the Channel Tunnel, meeting the people above and below ground who keep everything moving through the longest undersea tunnel in the world. The Eurotunnel teams at both ends are on a mission to keep everything on track getting dog owners home after Crufts, keeping trucks moving despite strikes at French customs and making sure the trains keep circulating, no matter what

programme.title: An Art Lovers Guide
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miro and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudí

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer?
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle explores how the kings choices in art and architecture provide clues to his mental state in the 1530s. Following the monarchs break from Rome, divorce from Catherine of Aragon and subsequent marriage to Anne Boleyn in the hope of finally fathering an heir, his desperation for a new image was at its peak

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team delves into the world of astronaut training, discovering what it takes to become a European Space Agency astronaut. As Europe looks to play a more prominent role in space exploration, the programme shines a spotlight on candidates pushing boundaries and preparing to represent Great Britain and Northern Ireland amongst the stars. Helen Sharman, the first British astronaut, joins Chris Lintott at the Science Museum to celebrate the opening of the new space gallery

programme.title: Professor Angie Hobbs Remembers - The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: The philosopher and academic gives a modern take on Bryan Magees highly influential 1987 series about the history of western philosophy. She examines its approach and ideas and the thinking that it explored, explaining how it inspired her and many others to explore philosophy when it was first broadcast

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: A 1987 series in which Bryan Magee presented a history of western philosophy. In the first edition, he is joined by Myles Burnyeat to look at the works of Plato, universally recognised as the first western philosopher whose written works survived

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Martha Nussbaum to explore the ideas and principles of Greek philosopher Aristotle, whose work dominated western thought for many hundreds of years

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Anthony Kenny to look at medieval philosophers and the contribution of figures such as St Augustine and Thomas Aquinas

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits Englands oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: Documentary that goes behind the scenes of the Channel Tunnel, meeting the people above and below ground who keep everything moving through the longest undersea tunnel in the world. The Eurotunnel teams at both ends are on a mission to keep everything on track getting dog owners home after Crufts, keeping trucks moving despite strikes at French customs and making sure the trains keep circulating, no matter what

programme.title: An Art Lovers Guide
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miro and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudí

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: This edition explores why two tunnels are better than one and follows the catenary team every step of the way as they fix the overhead cables in the wet area of the tunnel. There is also a drivers eye view of the giant crossover doors that link one tunnel to another in the biggest undersea cave ever built. Also, the team meet Maurice, the tunnel travelling bulldog

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara apply their creative talents when they try to make clothes out of nettles and wool, while Jerry has his eye on becoming the next managing director of JJM. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker prepares to make his first public broadcast as prime minister, but finds it is not so easy to speak to camera as he imagined. John Wells guest stars, alongside Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson hosts a game of word definitions and deceptions. Captains Frank Muir and Patrick Campbell are joined by Tom Baker, Alan Coren, Gabrielle Drake and Miriam Stoppard. First broadcast 27 May 1977

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Judith Jackson, Robin Ray and Patrick Moore. With guest musician Louis Kentner. First broadcast 21 November 1976

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: When Russia invaded Ukraine, a schoolteacher in a small industrial town picked up his camera and began filming covertly, becoming an unlikely dissident. His footage captures a portrait of how propaganda has seeped into everyday life in Russia, with patriotic lessons and military drills replacing regular classes, drawing children into the machinery of war

programme.title: Blood and Gold: The Making of Spain with Simon Sebag Montefiore
programme.desc: The historian uncovers the truth about Spains hero El Cid. He also investigates the attack on the city-state of Granada, waged by King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella, the horror of the Spanish Inquisition, and in the process discovers an unsettling story about one of his own ancestors

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: How to Write a Mills and Boon: Timeshift
programme.desc: Author Stella Duffy sets out to produce her own novel for Mills and Boon, the company that has become one of the biggest names in romantic fiction. She enlists the help of some avid fans in a challenging mission that takes her from London to Italy and offers an insight into the joy and frustration of writing

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: This edition explores why two tunnels are better than one and follows the catenary team every step of the way as they fix the overhead cables in the wet area of the tunnel. There is also a drivers eye view of the giant crossover doors that link one tunnel to another in the biggest undersea cave ever built. Also, the team meet Maurice, the tunnel travelling bulldog

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer?
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle explores how the kings choices in art and architecture provide clues to his mental state in the 1530s. Following the monarchs break from Rome, divorce from Catherine of Aragon and subsequent marriage to Anne Boleyn in the hope of finally fathering an heir, his desperation for a new image was at its peak

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Police appeal for information about allegations of past sexual abuse at a school, and the extraordinary story of the gang who stole a gold toilet from Blenheim Palace

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in Warwickshire to see a property above a former brewery, with a quirky layout and a holey roof. Dion Dublin heads to Staffordshire to visit a three-bed mid-terrace with a huge back garden boasting elevated views over Stoke-on-Trent. The programme also revisits a property in Nottinghamshire, where a couple bought a former farm building at auction to turn into their dream forever home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Danny Sebastian assist the teams in Ardingly, while Natasha Raskin Sharp learns about a British furniture designer who crafted iconic designs from recycled materials

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Former police officer Ahron is tracking a stolen MG following a spate of car thefts in Leeds. He finds an illegal chop shop - but has the car already been broken up for parts?

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: Helen Skelton leads a team of experts searching for lost treasures around the Lake District and reunite them with previous owners. In the first episode, the team takes on a desperate search to find two beloved rings, and after a valuable find during an underwater search, social media detective Mui tries to track down the owner

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from Berkshire who are looking for a fresh start in a new home in the Herefordshire countryside, following a life-threatening, life-changing event

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts repair a Syrian rocking horse that has quite literally been through the wars, an ice cream trailer bought to sell gelato at weddings in the 1990s, a pocket dictionary that connects its owner to his late mother and a bell owned by the first ever female town crier for Lytham in Lancashire

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A worrying situation escalates in Albert Square and Teddy and Gina grow concerned for Harry

programme.title: Why Planes Crash
programme.desc: Documentary examining the reasons behind four plane crashes that occurred within a six-month period, resulting in a total of 506 deaths in a disastrous year for aviation. The programme examines a plane skidding off the runway in South Korea, a collision between a passenger plane and a military helicopter in Washington DC, a commuter jet rolling over on landing in Toronto, and an Air India plane crashing just seconds after take-off

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Grace and Shane push boundaries for Lindsays sake as a threat closes in. Aisling and Tommy respond to a call-out where things are not as they seem, with unexpected consequences

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Stitched Up? Surgery in the Sun
programme.desc: Aoife Moore is in Istanbul with Chloe and her husband Chris, as Chloe undergoes for a boob job in a luxury five-star facility. She also reconnects with Martin, one of over 100,000 British and Irish patients who travel abroad each year for cosmetic dentistry

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon as a British-Jamaican film-maker facing the day-to-day struggles of being an independent creative trying to survive in London. Kwabena searches for his first directing job, but only finds scripts built on tired black stereotypes. With time running out, he considers whether to take any job or hold out for integrity. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon, Dani Moseley and Demmy Ladipo

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas long-awaited break comes with Sin and Subterfuge, a radical colour-blind Regency drama. What at first feels like a dream project soon raises unsettling questions and Kwabena tries to find a solution. A spark with talented actress comes at the worst possible time when an old flame resurfaces. Meanwhile, Funmi and Maurice sharpen their airs and graces in a bid to secure Mayowa a place at the boroughs top nursery. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas first day on set finds him working with his hero, legendary actor Rudolph Williams. Determined to support the veteran performer, his good intentions are tested by the relentless demands of the shoot. To make matters worse, Vanessa weighs heavily on his mind, after their run-in brings up feelings he struggles to ignore. Maurice and Funmi are called in by the nursery after an altercation between Mayowa and another child, but are surprised to find things arent as they first assumed. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Lawrence Chaney, Hannah Cockroft, Rick Edwards, Darren Harriott, Sarah Parish and Fay Ripley take part in the quiz show in which contestants and their celebrity partners must outsmart each other to win a cash prize. Hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Gordon Smart present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Steph McGovern ask how vulnerable 43-year-old Julius Matera ended up being left for dead in Eccles, Manchester. Plus, police urge any other victims of a male rapist to come forward

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development progress of a large home in Barry in south Wales, a terrace in Nuneaton and a quirky one-bedroom flat in a Victorian former schoolhouse on the Isle of Wight

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross travels to Shrewsbury in Shropshire, where Tim Weeks and Ben Cooper provide expert help as the red and blue teams compete to see who can make the most profit at auction. Charlie goes round the fair quizzing members of the public on a rather unusual antique he has brought along

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Tracker Neil hunts down a stolen pickup hidden on a remote industrial estate. But before he can seize it, he is confronted by a man claiming he bought the vehicle at an auction

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The scuba team members dive to their greatest depth yet in search of a drone for a pair of heartbroken newlyweds and social media detective Mui tries to return a phone full of memories to its rightful owner. Crafter Lucy takes on a shattered teapot fished out of the water and attempts to make something special out of it

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson sets about finding the ideal Wye Valley property for a pair of house hunters. Having put their Portugal home on the market, they have recently been touring the UK in their camper van and are itching to settle down somewhere with more space inside and out

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Leather worker Suzie Fletcher and textile conservator Rebecca Bissonnet restore a jacket and collar that once belonged to a rescue dog that helped search for survivors of the Lockerbie bombing disaster. Carpenter Will Kirk fixes a table bought in 1975 by a couple who had just moved to the UK from India, Pete Woods is tasked with repairing a saxophone played by a semi-professional musician over a career that spanned the 1940s to the 1990s and cobbler Dean Westmoreland tackles a pair of rugby boots that dragged the ball over the try line and won the match for England in the Womens World Cup in the 1994/95 season

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the quiz where contestants try to score as few points as possible. As ever, players attempt to come up with the answers no one else could think of on subjects including Winners of 2024

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Okie finds a new way to manipulate a situation and Ross is shocked by recent events. Elaine reveals her big plans to Yolande

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: Theres Life in the Old Dog Still
programme.desc: Stacey heads off to Lake Como to launch a new beauty product while Joe is left at home managing the kids, a poorly pooch and a long list of chores - so he invites his family over to help out. On Staceys return from Italy, Joe goes above and beyond to organise an epic date night - a singalong with one of Essexs biggest gospel choirs - and the family celebrate the arrival of summer with an epic pool party

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Stella feels the weight of recent events when her daughter arrives at school. Mitch finds himself in hot water after stepping in to help a struggling student and Dwayne returns to a mostly warm reception. Darius turns to Jack for guidance as he eyes a bigger role within the school

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Darragh MacIntyre investigates how global drugs cartels are using Ireland as a route to get hundreds of millions of pounds worth of cocaine into Great Britain and Europe

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The funfair arrives at Waterloo Road as Darius tries to escape the fallout from his actions. Has his luck finally run out? Agnes uncovers a secret that could blow a familys world apart, and Dontes loyalties are tested by a discovery that could end a colleagues career

programme.title: William Shakespeares Romeo + Juliet
programme.desc: A city is divided by the conflict between two feuding families - the fathers are bitter business rivals, and the younger generation are continually fighting in the streets. The son of one household falls in love at first sight with his enemys daughter - but the vendetta threatens their secret romance. Baz Luhrmanns modern update of Shakespeares tragic love story, with Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, Pete Postlethwaite and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Mankinds most ingenious inventors are given the Horrible Histories treatment, as we take in everything from the invention of the wheel to the crisp

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Wales v Belgium (Kick-off 7.45pm). Catrin Heledd is joined by Ashley Williams, Rob Earnshaw and Joe Ledley to present coverage of the FIFA World Cup Group J qualifier, which takes place at Cardiff City Stadium. The reverse fixture at King Baudouin Stadium in Brussels in June produced a seven-goal thriller, as Craig Bellamys men fought back from 3-0 down after just 27 minutes to draw level with the Belgians in the second half, only for Kevin de Bruyne to score the winner two minutes from time, securing the points. With commentary by Simon Davies and Nia Jones

programme.title: Blackmailed: The Sextortion Killers
programme.desc: Reporter Tir Dhondy investigates the rise of sextortion scams targeting teenage boys on social media, including the case of 16-year-old victim Evan Boettler. Her journey leads to Nigeria, where she confronts the scammers taking part in these crimes. With unprecedented access and interviews with industry insiders, Tir exposes a disturbing online underworld and its devastating consequences

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: The six newlywed couples are over halfway through their adventure. But the arrival of the flare and a way out of the experience makes waves for three couples who are facing major challenges. While some relationships reach new heights, one couple hits breaking point

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: The couples awaken to the aftermath of a tense Couples Cove gathering

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: With less than a week to go, the couples are contemplating their relationships on the outside, where the distractions of everyday life will all come back into play

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.desc: Professor Philip Goodman, famous for debunking hoaxes and ghost sightings, is given a dossier of three terrifying, unsolvable cases by his hero and role model Charles Cameron, who has been missing, presumed dead, for years. Can Goodman explain what even Cameron could not? Horror anthology, starring Andy Nyman, Martin Freeman and Paul Whitehouse

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The team takes a look at America and its various Presidents, from George Washington to the present day, including President Jacksons rude parrot

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Songs and sketches about the most ruthless rulers of all time, featuring Henry VIII, Louis XIV and the Vikings

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.desc: Undercover report from an overstretched 999 control room. With services facing a record level of demand, the programme reveals how patients face dangerous delays and having to choose between waiting for an ambulance or risking making their own way to hospital. Some callers are told an ambulance is being arranged when staff are actually deciding whether they need one. Targets are routinely missed. As winter approaches, Dispatches asks whether the Government is doing enough to fix the crisis in emergency care

Michael also explores the cobbled backstreets, finding a historic bakery and the two cakes for the which the town is renowned - a small cheesecake called a queijada and an almond-cream-filled puff-pastry known as a travesseiro

Higdon was arrested and charged with a hate-fuelled murder

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Newport, Gwent, where he learns about the heroism of a young boy who was awarded the Albert Medal, before visiting a cinema dating from 1912 in Clevedon

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Taunton and Newton Abbot. Along the way he joins in with a fertility dance in Stogumber, visits a celebrated garden at Hestercombe to discover the fruits of an unusual partnership, and enjoys a trip aboard the longest heritage line in England

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: The ruler of the Persian empire vows to expand his realm by conquering Greece. The king of Sparta steps forward to defend his homeland and the other kingdoms of Greece, but when he is betrayed by a political council, he finds himself without an army and must fend off the vast invading army with a mere 300 warriors. Historical drama, starring Richard Egan, Ralph Richardson and Diane Baker

programme.title: Henry VIII and His Six Wives
programme.desc: The Tudor monarch looks back on his tumultuous reign as he lies on his deathbed. He remembers the six women he made his queen, and how the series of unsuccessful marriages impacted on the political state of England and led to the downfall of some of his most trusted allies. Historical drama, starring Keith Michell, Donald Pleasence, Charlotte Rampling and Brian Blessed

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter captures young killer Billy John, but his real motive is not the cash reward - he has an old score to settle with his prisoners brother Frank. As the journey to bring the murderer to justice gets under way, he is counting on a showdown with Frank and accepts the help of two outlaw gunmen for added protection, aware they will try to turn Billy John in themselves for the reward and a pardon. Western, with Randolph Scott, Lee Van Cleef, James Best, James Coburn and Pernell Roberts.

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: The penniless grandson of a duke plots to eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and a vast inheritance. He shoots, drowns, poisons and explodes his way through his family tree, but his final triumph is ruined when his lady loves husband kills himself. Ealing black comedy, starring Alec Guinness as all eight potential victims, with Dennis Price, Valerie Hobson and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: Land
programme.desc: Edee, in the aftermath of an unfathomable event, finds herself unable to stay connected to the world she once knew and in the face of that uncertainty, retreats to the magnificent but unforgiving wilds of the Rockies. After a local hunter brings her back from the brink of death, she must find a way to live again. Drama, directed by and starring Robin Wright, with Demián Bichir and Sarah Dawn Pledge

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: In the 11th century, a group of Europeans set out for China to discover how to make gunpowder. However, on arrival their claims to be on a trading mission are disbelieved and they are arrested and imprisoned by the Nameless Order within the Great Wall - just as it is about to be beset by giant, lizard-like monsters. As wave after wave of attacks and surprise tactics batter the Wall, Europeans and Chinese battle hordes of the creatures in a series of escalating conflicts leading to a final confrontation with the alien queen. Fantasy adventure, starring Matt Damon, Willem Dafoe and Tian Jing

programme.title: The Forever Purge
programme.desc: Members of an underground movement, no longer satisfied with the annual night of anarchy and murder, decide to take over the United States through an unending campaign of mayhem and massacre. On the morning after The Purge, a masked gang of killers attacks a wealthy Texas ranching family and their workers. Exposed by daylight, the two families are forced to band together and fight back as the country spirals into chaos and begins to disintegrate around them. Horror sequel, starring Ana de la Reguera

programme.title: Piggy
programme.desc: An overweight teen is bullied by a gang of cool girls while holidaying in her village. Horror, starring Laura Galan and Richard Holmes. In Spanish with English subtitles

programme.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
programme.desc: Veteran officer Robert Sharkey is recruited to train a team of intelligence service agents. When one of them turns out to be a German mole, Sharkey feeds him misinformation to take back to the Gestapo. However, the rogue spy outsmarts his peers and murders an agent. Without time to recruit a replacement, Sharkey steps in to head a dangerous mission in the heart of Nazi-occupied France. Second World War thriller, with James Cagney, Richard Conte, Walter Abel, Frank Latimore and Annabella

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: A ruthless cattle baron sets out to create his own private empire, no matter what the cost. When he resorts to murder, he makes an enemy of a civil war veteran, while his lust for power drives his wife into the arms of his younger brother. Western, starring Edward G Robinson, Barbara Stanwyck and Glenn Ford

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Miser Ebenezer Scrooge is given a Christmas Eve to remember when a quartet of ghosts - his dead business partner and the spirits of Christmases past, present and future - turn up determined to cure him of his money-grubbing ways. Adaptation of Charles Dickens classic, starring George C Scott, Nigel Davenport, Frank Finlay, Angela Pleasence, David Warner, Edward Woodward and Susannah York

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: Three decades ago, Clifford McBride led a voyage into deep space, but the crew were never heard from again. Now his son, Roy, embarks on a daring mission to Neptune to uncover the truth about his missing father and a strange power surge that threatens the stability of the universe. Director James Grays sci-fi drama, starring Brad Pitt, Tommy Lee Jones and Ruth Negga

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: A man whos given up on life following the loss of his wife and wants to end it all. When a young family moves in nearby, he meets his match in quick-witted Marisol, leading to a friendship that will turn his world around. Comedy drama, starring Tom Hanks, Mariana Trevino and Rachel Keller

programme.title: Nuns on the Run
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks decide to go straight and steal a fortune from their furious crime kingpin boss - who had in turn stolen it from equally disgruntled Chinese gangsters. Needing somewhere to lay low, they pose as nuns - but fitting in in a convent proves tricky. Comedy, starring Eric Idle, Robbie Coltrane and Camille Coduri

programme.title: The Eyes of Tammy Faye
programme.desc: Tammy Faye Grover is raised in a blended family of eight children in International Falls, Minnesota. In 1960 at North Central Bible College, she meets elevangelist Jim Bakker and they forego studies to marry and establish a travelling ministry, which leads to a big break on the Christian Broadcasting Network. True-life drama, starring an Oscar-winning Jessica Chastain, with Andrew Garfield and Cherry Jones

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Rob and Jo Smiths dog-friendly BandB in Hope Mountain, north Wales. Eyebrows are raised when self-styled queens of clean Steffi Stephenson and Sarah Banks find evidence of their pet hate. During an afternoon making jam, identical twins Fernando and Emilio Tundidor reveal a competitive streak. At breakfast, Denise and Alan Newman are surprisingly demanding

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Beaumont Hotel in Louth, Lincolnshire, two guests are damning about the breakfast quality, so it remains to be seen how managers Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks will react

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is being ably assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Troy House in Painswick, Gloucestershire, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope the guests will love their rooms, but Emilio and Fernando are on the warpath

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the BandB owners meet up for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw enter the weird and wonderful world of the Bond Bug - a wedge-shaped three-wheel car from the early 1970s. The car belongs to 69-year-old Ian, whose dreams of joining the Bond Bug owners club and taking part in rallies and car shows were cruelly thwarted when he developed Parkinsons disease. Tim and Fuzz step in to get his quirky motor up and running while he is still able to enjoy it

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and petrolhead Tim Shaw return to rescue more classic cars for deserving owners. They begin in County Down in Northern Ireland where the 1987 MG Metro 6R4 rally car has turned up in a scrapyard. The family of rally enthusiast Brian put in the call when a serious stroke prevented him from restoring his amazing discovery, and former driver David Gillanders joins in the fun to rescue the car he last drove three decades ago

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Fresh from the success of hosting a three-day wedding at the chateau, Dick and Angel make business plans for the grounds, intending to charge people to fish in the moat and forage in the woods. Angel starts work on a second guest suite, but also wants to install an elevator, which pushes Dicks engineering skills to the limit

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Lucy had a stroke four years ago at the age of 31 and she and her sisters think a dog will aid her recovery, so they meet Fox the chihuahua cross at Animal Welfare League NSW

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: When it comes to dating etiquette, Breeze the American bulldog cross leaves a lot to be desired upon meeting Charlotte. Will the 31-year-old still fall for him though? Nettle the pointer would like some stability in her life, but it remains to be seen whether she can stay put long enough for any potential new owners to fall for her. The Woodgreen staff hope that Eileen from Middlesbrough will prove the ideal person to help nervy terrier Austin find his confidence

programme.title: Ancient Autopsy
programme.desc: Professor Suzannah Lipscomb investigates the mystery behind the untimely death of Tutankhamun. High-speed chariot tests and rare access to Howard Carters original diary provide clues that reveal startling new possibilities. Meanwhile, Dr Richard Shepherd uses a digital autopsy to test the most debated theories surrounding the boy-kings demise

programme.title: Tutankhamun: Secrets of the Tomb
programme.desc: Part one of two. On 26th November 1922, Howard Carter made the greatest archaeological find of all time - the treasure-filled tomb of Egyptian boy king Tutankhamun. An unrivalled discovery made possible by Carters extraordinary tenacity and the dedicated financier by his side, Lord Carnarvon. But when people who entered the tomb began dying, tales spread of a Pharaohs Curse. In this first episode, paleo-anthropologist Ella Al-Shamahi begins to unravel the extraordinary scientific truth behind the legend and the press sensation that surrounded it for decades. As she travels from Tuts tomb in Egypts Valley of the Kings, to a shrine in Wawel cathedral in Krakow, Poland, the investigation links a series of mysterious deaths in both locations, each attributed to a curse. Ella unearths the truly deadly secret lurking in these tombs

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Mark, 32, is brought to resus with a head injury after having an epileptic seizure, and he is sent for an urgent CT scan to assess the damage to his brain. Anastasia, 80, comes to urgent care with a pain in her leg and while she is sent for an X-ray to rule out a blood clot, she shares the story of her arrival to study in England from Nigeria, only for civil war to break out back home. Porter Chris, whos been part of the AandE department for 25 years, shares his insights into the job as he goes about his day

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A teenager with anorexia nervosa is rushed into the paediatrics emergency department with dangerously low blood pressure. Her mother reflects on her daughters lifelong struggle with her eating disorder, and the pain she feels at being unable to protect her child. A 66-year-old man who fell from a great height onto a concrete surface is brought in to St Georges, and doctors fear he has sustained organ damage and internal bleeding. His daughter talks about their close relationship and the sacrifices her father has made over the years

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: The documentary following the paramedics of West Midlands Ambulance Service returns. On the way back to base, one team is flagged down by police officers dealing with a man who has overdosed on drugs. They are also called out to a woman with gynaecological problems, who is losing a lot of blood and needs to go to hospital, and a man who has a condition where his throat swells up and closes without warning

programme.title: Ancient Autopsy
programme.desc: Professor Suzannah Lipscomb investigates the mystery behind the untimely death of Tutankhamun. High-speed chariot tests and rare access to Howard Carters original diary provide clues that reveal startling new possibilities. Meanwhile, Dr Richard Shepherd uses a digital autopsy to test the most debated theories surrounding the boy-kings demise

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team revisits favourite investigations, including Kate Quiltons visit to the worlds largest producer of jelly beans to find out what goes into the sweets. programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.desc: Newfoundland Sylvie is a big therapy dog with big soft cuddles who loves to help people when theyre worried. She and her owner Katrina visit all sorts of people every day, young and old. Sylvie has a bit of a sniffle, so Katrina makes an appointment for her to see the vet. Its usually Sylvies job to help others feel calm, but now she needs to help herself. Katrina always gets worried when Sylvie is poorly, so next she needs to calm Katrinas nerves. The vet gives her the all-clear, but in the waiting room a little girl called Dina is very worried about her cat, Mittens, who has had an accident. So Sylvie puts her harness on and supercharges her super heart.

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Hearing dog Diesel is off to the beach with his owner Rayane so Rayane can try out the new metal detector he got for his birthday. Rayane is deaf, which means he doesnt hear everything, and Diesels super ears are trained to alert Rayane to important sounds he might miss. Diesel is Rayanes ears! Rayane and Diesel have been practising with the metal detector in the garden. At the beach, Diesel helps Mum find the perfect spot for a picnic. Then Rayane and Diesel head off with their metal detector in search of some treasure. They find a harmonica, a spoon, some coins, a metal clip and then… a set of car keys. They head back up the beach to find Mum, and together they set off to reunite the missing car keys with their owner. Can Diesels super ears save the day again?

However, they did claim a 3-2 win when the teams last met here in a 2022 UEFA Nations League contest, with Robbie Brady scoring the winner from the penalty spot in the first minute of second half stoppage time, just after the Armenians had seen two players receive red cards. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. programme.desc: When an acid-tongued gossip columnist lets fly with another barrage of witty one-liners, his victims want revenge. Luckily, a pair of young actors are on hand to teach him a lesson

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.sub-title: A Girl Cant Always Have Everything
programme.desc: A selfish actress used to having her own way asks her friend for help - but may be expecting too much after catching the eye of a rich, elderly widower. Joan Collins and Pauline Collins star

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life and career of musician and actor David Bowie, who returned to the top of the charts in 2013 with The Next Day, his first album in a decade. Music critics and DJs offer their thoughts on the London-born artists colourful career and enduring success

programme.title: Stories from the National Gallery
programme.desc: Part one of two. To mark the 200th anniversary of the art museum, Kate Bryan explores the stories behind key artworks in the gallerys collection

programme.title: The Directors
programme.desc: A look at the life and career of American director Martin Scorsese, whose films include Taxi Driver, Raging Bull and Goodfellas and who won an Oscar for directing The Departed

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A profile of the American actor, whose roles in the Star Wars and Indiana Jones franchises have made him one of the biggest stars in the world

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A crooked antiques dealer masquerading as a clergyman encounters a farmer - who gives him a piece of furniture worth a fortune. Starring John Gielgud and Bernard Miles

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A scorned husband seeks revenge on his wife and her lover - but is not certain who the man is. Starring Denholm Elliott and Joss Ackland

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A man expects to inherit his familys fortune when his uncle dies, but he is astonished when everything is left to his relatives pet dog for the balance of its lifetime

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A studio publicist takes advantage of a movie stars death to hype her final film to try to ensure it will be a big hit

programme.title: Arts Wildest Movement: Mannerism
programme.desc: Art historian Waldemar Januszczak explores the style of 16th-century European art in which the human imagination was allowed to run wild and be exciting

programme.title: Arts Most
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak goes looking for the Devil, the ultimate shape-shifter, who keeps popping up in art in an assortment of disguises

programme.title: A Sudden Glimpse to Deeper Things
programme.desc: Mark Cousins film explores the pivotal 1949 experience atop Switzerlands Grindelwald glacier that reshaped British modernist painter Wilhelmina Barns-Grahams artistic perspective for decades to come. With narration by Tilda Swinton

programme.title: Mary Cassatt: Painting the Modern Woman
programme.desc: Revisit the career of Mary Cassatt through prints, pastels and paintings, exploring the often-overlooked impressionists influence on how women appear in art

programme.title: 50 Years on Film: David Hockney
programme.desc: Using clips from more than half a century of archive footage, this film looks back at the life and career of David Hockney, one of Britains greatest artists

programme.title: Portrait Artist of the Year
programme.sub-title: James May, Billy Porter, Emma Barnett
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan invites nine artists to paint celebrity sitters James May, Billy Porter and Emma Barnett as Tai Shan Schierenberg, Kathleen Soriano and Kate Bryan judge the efforts

programme.title: Lily and Lolly: The Forgotten Yeats Sisters
programme.desc: Imelda May explores the story of WB Yeats two sisters Susan Lily Yeats and Elizabeth Lolly Yeats, who played a significant role in the revival of Irish literature in the 1920s

programme.title: Inside Art
programme.desc: To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the Hepworth Wakefield, Kate Bryan explores the art museums vast collection of work by the sculptor it is named after

programme.title: Richard E Grants Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor explores Berlin, visiting the arty Propeller Island City Lodge - a hotel where guests can fulfil their fantasies by sleeping in lion cages, coffins or rotating beds. At the Schlosshotel in affluent Grunewald, cabaret dancer Romy Haag talks to Richard about her affair with David Bowie, who stayed at the hotel while living in the German capital in the 1970s

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. He begins in London at St Pauls Cathedral, where he visits a place tourists never go, before exploring a hidden park and a little-known church. He also gets a guided tour of Soho from broadcaster Danny Baker

programme.title: Boardwalk Empire
programme.desc: Nucky and his assistant are forced to seek refuge with local racketeer Chalky White when Rosetti makes his move in Atlantic City. Drama set during the 1920s, starring Steve Buscemi and Michael Kenneth Williams

programme.desc: Gyp Rosettis alliance with Mafia don Joe Masseria backs Nucky into a corner and he is forced to cede control of one of his prized assets to Arnold Rothstein. programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street

programme.desc: In Seattle, Ellie and Dina find themselves amid a brutal battle between the zealous Seraphites and a ruthless militia

Meanwhile, Carlton Towers in East Yorkshire hosts an annual dog show for Afghan hounds

programme.title: Vendetta

After killing the street thug who was directly responsible for her death, he finds himself in the middle of a war with the dead mans brother, who is equally hell-bent on getting even. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis and Thomas Jane

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: A military officer goes in search of a power-mad general who is holding several hostages in a secret location. He soon finds he is not the only one on the maniacs trail, and joins forced with a mismatched band of martial artists to save the captives. Action adventure based on the video game, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Raul Julia, Kylie Minogue and Ming-Na Wen

programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.desc: American soldiers are sent into war-torn Mogadishu in 1993 on a routine search and capture operation. Learning some of their compatriots have been shot down, they feel compelled to mount a perilous rescue attempt - one that descends into all-out conflict with heavily armed Somalians. Ridley Scotts fact-based drama, starring Josh Hartnett, Eric Bana, Ewan McGregor, Tom Sizemore and Orlando Bloom

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: A former Marine sniper is coaxed back into action when government officials need his help to prevent an assassination attempt on the US president. However, the intended target is in fact an African archbishop, and the marksman is set up by double-crossing agents to take the fall, forcing him to go on the run as he fights to clear his name. Action thriller, with Mark Wahlberg, Michael Pena and Danny Glover

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Married explorers Rick and Evelyn battle the newly resurrected mummy Imhotep and his ruthless partner, who have captured their son. The undead creature is heading for a confrontation with a legendary ancient warrior - with power over a magical army to be won. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr and Patricia Velasquez, with a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson

programme.title: The Scorpion King

Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan

Steven Spielbergs action adventure, starring Harrison Ford, Kate Capshaw, Ke Huy Quan and Amrish Puri

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, the third instalment in the successful franchise. Harrison Ford stars, alongside Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: A military officer goes in search of a power-mad general who is holding several hostages in a secret location. He soon finds he is not the only one on the maniacs trail, and joins forced with a mismatched band of martial artists to save the captives. Action adventure based on the video game, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Raul Julia, Kylie Minogue and Ming-Na Wen

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: A young lad is transported to a parallel universe where he is caught in a battle between a mysterious gunslinger and a sinister sorcerer. Fantasy adventure based on the Stephen King novels, starring Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey and Tom Taylor

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: A wealthy playboy inherits a media empire when his father dies. Determined to do some good for a change, he uses his new-found fortune to become a masked crime-fighter. Aided by his chauffeur, who is a kung fu expert and a technical genius, he fights to bring down a powerful gangster. Comic-book adventure, starring Seth Rogen, Jay Chou, Cameron Diaz and Christoph Waltz

programme.desc: American soldiers are sent into war-torn Mogadishu in 1993 on a routine search and capture operation. Ridley Scotts fact-based drama, starring Josh Hartnett, Eric Bana, Ewan McGregor, Tom Sizemore and Orlando Bloom

Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey

Comedy adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Austin OBrien, Charles Dance, F Murray Abraham and Anthony Quinn

Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Maria Bello, Jet Li and Michelle Yeoh.

programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. programme.desc: The globe-trotting archaeologist teams up with a rebellious teenager who draws him into a search in the Amazon jungle for a mysterious artefact of untold power. But their quest is hindered by Soviet agents who also want the fabled object for a more sinister purpose. Action adventure sequel, starring Harrison Ford, Cate Blanchett, Shia LaBeouf, Ray Winstone and John Hurt

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: A young lad is transported to a parallel universe where he is caught in a battle between a mysterious gunslinger and a sinister sorcerer. Fantasy adventure based on the Stephen King novels, starring Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey and Tom Taylor

programme.title: Midnight Run
programme.desc: When accountant Jonathan Mardukas skips bail after having been arrested for embezzlement, bounty hunter Jack Walsh is hired to catch the fraudster and return him from New York to Los Angeles. Unfortunately, his task is hindered by the ingenuity of Mardukas and the attentions of pursuing FBI agents and Mafia hitmen. Comedy thriller, starring Robert De Niro, Charles Grodin, Yaphet Kotto, Dennis Farina, John Ashton and Joe Pantoliano

programme.desc: A battle-hardened special forces operative attempts to rescue his kidnapped niece when a mercenary mission spirals into chaos. Action thriller, starring Eden Brolin, Andy Garcia and Melissa Leo

programme.desc: A swashbuckling hero has 10 days to recover a priceless book from a deceitful sea goddess or his friend will be executed. Animated adventure, with the voices of Brad Pitt, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Joseph Fiennes and Michelle Pfeiffer

Animated adventure, with the voices of Lacey Chabert, Tim Curry, Tom Kane, Cree Summer, Lynn Redgrave and Jodi Carlisle

programme.desc: The bungling leader of a band of inept buccaneers is determined to prove his worth to his rivals and win the coveted Pirate of the Year award. Animated comedy, with the voices of Hugh Grant, Martin Freeman, Imelda Staunton and David Tennant

programme.desc: Boog the bear visits a Russian travelling circus, where he meets another bear named Doug who is his exact double. Doug suggests they swap places for the day, but when the time comes to go back to their old lives, Doug is nowhere to be found, leaving Boog trapped. Animated adventure, with the voices of Matthew J Munn and Matthew W Taylor

programme.desc: In a city of humanoid animals, a hustling koalas attempt to save his theatre with a singing competition becomes grander than he anticipates, while the finalists of the contest find that their lives will never be the same again. Animated comedy, with the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane, Scarlett Johansson, John C Reilly, Taron Egerton, Jennifer Saunders and Jennifer Hudson

programme.desc: A young penguin disappoints his fellow seabirds with his inability to sing - but instead he displays a remarkable talent for tap dancing. However, his elders refuse to accept this outlandish behaviour and send the youngster into exile, marking the start of a wonderful journey. Animated adventure, with the voices of Elijah Wood, Robin Williams, Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman

programme.title: Penguins of Madagascar

Animated comedy spin-off, with the voices of Benedict Cumberbatch, John Malkovich and Tom McGrath
